text: The 1994 San Francisco Giants season was the Giants' 112th season in Major League Baseball, their 37th season in San Francisco since their move from New York following the 1957 season, and their 35th at Candlestick Park. After winning 103 games in 1993, the Giants record dropped to 55-60 in a strike- shortened season. This was also the season in which Matt Williams hit a career high 43 home runs through 115 games by the time the strike hit, on pace to finish with 61; had the season continued, Williams may have had a chance to break Roger Maris's then-single season record of 61 home runs set in 1961. ==Offseason== *November 21, 1993: Mark Portugal signed as a Free Agent with the San Francisco Giants.Mark Portugal Statistics Baseball-Reference.com *December 20, 1993: Rex Hudler was signed as a Free Agent with the San Francisco Giants.https://www.baseball-reference.com/h/hudlere01.shtml *March 22, 1994: Rex Hudler was released by the San Francisco Giants. ==Regular season== By Friday, August 12, the Giants had compiled a 55-60 record through 115 games. They had scored 504 runs (4.38 per game) and allowed 500 runs (4.35 per game).https://www.baseball-reference.com/leagues/NL/1994.shtml The Giants were struggling offensively prior to the Strike, at 28th in batting average (.249), doubles (159) and overall hits (963).https://www.baseball- reference.com/leagues/MLB/1994.shtml Their pitchers also struggled, combining to finish 28th in complete games, with just 2. ===Notable transactions=== * June 19, 1994: Darryl Strawberry signed as a Free Agent with the San Francisco Giants. * June 29, 1994: Kent Bottenfield was signed as a Free Agent with the San Francisco Giants.https://www.baseball- reference.com/players/b/botteke01.shtml * September 14, 1994: Yorvit Torrealba was signed by the San Francisco Giants as an amateur free agent.https://www.baseball-reference.com/t/torreyo01.shtml ====Draft Picks==== {| |- |style="background-color:#CCFFCC; border:1px solid #aaaaaa; width:2em;"| |= Future All Star |} The following were notable Giants draft picks from the MLB Amateur Draft held on June 2, 1994. {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! style="background: #f47937;color:black;" width="9%" | Round ! style="background: #f47937;color:black;" width="9%" | Pick ! style="background: #f47937;color:black;" width="16%" | Player ! style="background: #f47937;color:black;" width="9%" | Nationality ! style="background: #f47937;color:black;" width="9%" | Status |- align="center" | 1 || 22 || Dante Powell Dante Powell Statistics Baseball-Reference.com|| || Player signed July 13, 1994. |- align="center" | 5 || || Bobby Howry https://www.baseball-reference.com/h/howrybo01.shtml|| || Player signed June 4, 1994. |- align="center" | 9 || || bgcolor="#CCFFCC"|Keith Foulke https://www.baseball-reference.com/f/foulkke01.shtml || || Player signed June 3, 1994. |- align="center" | 20 || || bgcolor="#CCFFCC"|J.
